Subject: obo:CAROLIO_0000400
Value: is a class for values when it is partitioned by a group of subclasses if a) the subclasses are mutually exclusive, i.e. pairwise disjoint; and b) the subclasses completely cover the parent class, i.e. that the union of the subclasses is equal to the parent class.

Subject: obo:CAROLIO_0000410
Value: is a level of pain that is further separated into 'mild pain', 'moderate pain', 'no pain', or 'severe pain' based on the realted Data Property:has recurrent value.

Subject: obo:CAROLIO_0000411
Value: is a pain scale that has pain scale value between 1 and 3.

Subject: obo:CAROLIO_0000412
Value: is a pain scale that has pain scale value between 4 and 6.

Subject: obo:CAROLIO_0000413
Value: is a pain scale that has pain scale value of 0.

Subject: obo:CAROLIO_0000414
Value: is a pain scale that has pain scale value between 7 and 10.

Subject: obo:CAROLIO_0000420
Value: is an object property that associates with a symptom as either recurrent or non-recurrent.

Subject: obo:CAROLIO_0000421
Value: is a symptom status that is for a symptom which occurs only once.

Subject: obo:CAROLIO_0000422
Value: is a symptom status that is for a symptom which occurs more than once.

Subject: obo:CAROLIO_0001000
Value: is a bile duct disease that consists of Caroliâ€™s disease and congenital hepatic fibrosis. It is characterized by multiple segmental cystic or saccular dilatations of intrahepatic bile ducts associated with congenital hepatic fibrosis.

Subject: obo:CAROLIO_0002000
Value: is a gastrointestinal bleeding symptom that implies on bleeding of varices found throughout the gastrointestinal tract, such as in the esophagus, stomach, and rectum

Subject: obo:CAROLIO_0003100
Value: is a nonsurgical technique for treating conditions affecting any part of your digestive tract.

Subject: obo:CAROLIO_0003110
Value: is a procedure that uses elastic bands to treat enlarged veins, or varices, in your esophagus. These abnormal veins develop in the esophagus and have thin walls with high blood pressure running through them.

Subject: obo:CAROLIO_0003120
Value: is a procedure that combines upper gastrointestinal (GI) endoscopy and x-rays to treat problems of the bile and pancreatic ducts.

Subject: obo:CAROLIO_0003121
Value: is a treatment procedure that helps drain extra bile. This treatment is used when there is too much bile in the bile ducts.

Subject: obo:CAROLIO_0003122
Value: is a procedure to stretch bile ducts that are too narrow.

Subject: obo:CAROLIO_0003123
Value: is an endoscopic treatment procedure that is performed to open a blocked bile duct. A stent is a small tube made of plastic or metal. The stent helps widen your bile duct and keeps it open.

Subject: obo:CAROLIO_0003124
Value: is an endoscopic retrograde cholangio-pancreatography (ERCP) treatment to remove gallstones.

Subject: obo:CAROLIO_0003200
Value: is a minimally invasive operation in which the surgeon is guided by real time imaging called scopy. Depending on the intervention, the scopy used can be fluoroscopy, scanner (X-rays), echography (ultrasound) or MRI (magnetic resonance) providing between 2 and 30 images per second.

Subject: obo:CAROLIO_0003210
Value: is a minimally invasive therapeutic procedures. With the aid of ultrasound guidance, an antitumoral device, drug, or chemical is introduced directly into the tumor and causes tumor death.

Subject: obo:CAROLIO_0003220
Value: is a procedure that removes fluid (peritoneal fluid) from the abdomen through a slender needle.

Subject: obo:CAROLIO_0003230
Value: is a treatment that often involves placing a drain or catheter percutaneously under imaging guidance.

Subject: obo:CAROLIO_0003240
Value: is a procedure performed for diagnostic and/or therapeutic purposes by first accessing the biliary tree with a needle and then usually shortly after that with a catheter (percutaneous biliary drainage or PBD).

Subject: obo:CAROLIO_0003250
Value: is a procedure to create new connections between two blood vessels in the liver.

Subject: obo:CAROLIO_0003300
Value: is a treatment of disease through the application of medications (drugs).

Subject: obo:CAROLIO_0003310
Value: is a treatment that is used to treat or prevent some types of bacterial infection.

Subject: obo:CAROLIO_0003320
Value: is a treatment that uses antimetic drugs to treat vomiting and nausea. Antiemetics are typically used to treat motion sickness and the side effects of opioid analgesics, general anaesthetics, and chemotherapy directed against cancer.

Subject: obo:CAROLIO_0003330
Value: is an oral treatment to improve viscosity of bile.

Subject: obo:CAROLIO_0003340
Value: is a pharmaceutical treatment that uses powerful chemicals to kill fast-growing cells in your body.

Subject: obo:CAROLIO_0003350
Value: is a therapeutic that uses diuretic medicines to help reduce fluid buildup in the body.

Subject: obo:CAROLIO_0003360
Value: is a medication treatment used in the management and treatment of acromegaly and thyrotrophinomas.

Subject: obo:CAROLIO_0003370
Value: is a medication treatment that works by reducing the amount of stomach acid made by glands in the lining of your stomach.

Subject: obo:CAROLIO_0003380
Value: is a topical, oral, or other treatment (e.g., light therapy)  for systemic itching.

Subject: obo:CAROLIO_0003400
Value: is a treatment that uses high doses of radiation to kill cancer cells and shrink tumors. At low doses, radiation is used in x-rays to see inside body, as with x-rays of your teeth or broken bones. At high doses, radiation therapy kills cancer cells or slows their growth by damaging their DNA.

Subject: obo:CAROLIO_0003500
Value: is a medical procedure involving an incision with instruments; performed to repair damage or arrest disease in a living body.

Subject: obo:CAROLIO_0003510
Value: is a procedure in which a functional, intact organ is transferred from one individual to another.

Subject: obo:CAROLIO_0003520
Value: is a type of weight-loss surgery that involves creating a small pouch from the stomach and connecting the newly created pouch directly to the small intestine.

Subject: obo:CAROLIO_0003530
Value: is a procedure during which part or all of a certain tissue or an organ is removed. An organ or tissue may need to be removed for various reasons, including disease, damage, or trauma.
